quote.author: Wikipedia - The definition of Language
quote.content: A language is a structured system of communication. Language, in a broader sense, is the method of communication that involves the use of – particularly human – languages.

paragraphs.content: Because I am a big fan of Elm, my first thought was if it was a good choice for my purpose. I have a little bit experience with elm-static, which is an opinionated tool for creating static html for your website. It supports markdown and elm-markup. However, in my humble opinion it is structural very complex, has a lot of boilerplate and the modularity of the markdown files is somehow hard to see through.

module Test exposing (..)
  import Html exposing (Html, div, h1, text)

  main : Html Never
  main =
      div [] [ h1 [] [ text "Hello World !" ]  ]
Finally, I was thinking: What would be the elm way of doing it ?
